newsitem.title: RUSSIA: PRESS DIGEST - RUSSIA IZVESTIA - JUNE 2.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - RUSSIA IZVESTIA - JUNE 2.

text.p: Following are some of the leading stories in the June 3 edition of Russia's Izvestia newspaper. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Russian Central Bank will license credit organisations on the securities markets.
- Sberbank, which holds about 75 percent of savings of Russians, will remain under state control.
- Almazy Rossii-Sakha is planning to issue unsecured eurobonds worth not less than $350 million.
- Forty percent of Russian naval vessels are obsolete and should be written off.
- Novolipetsk Metallurgical Kombinat shareholders are due to meet for their regular meeting on July 11-12.
- A draft law on regulation of property ownership is to be discussed by the State Duma on June 4.

- The number of alcohol-related deaths will continue to grow because people, exhausted by wages arrears, will look for low quality cheap vodka, says the paper in connection with a report from Krasnoyarsk where over 20 people died from drinking poisonous bootleg spirits.
